articles.author: Dana O'NeilESPN Senior Writer
articles.title: The Final Four of never, never, almost never and North Carolina
articles.description: This is South Carolina's first trip to the Final Four. Same for Gonzaga. Oregon has been here before, in 1939. Then there's North Carolina, for a 20th time. No, this isn't your normal Final Four.

articles.title: The moment that brought each team to the Final Four
articles.description: It takes talented players, good coaching and a little luck to win four straight games in the NCAA tournament. But for each Final Four team, there was a singular moment where it all clicked.

articles.author: Myron MedcalfESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: A miracle in Memphis: North Carolina back in the Final Four
articles.description: UNC is back in the Final Four, where it'll answer questions about the miracle shot in Memphis, not just the one that ended the Heels' 2015-16 season.

articles.author: Calvin WatkinsESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: Rockets use offense to roll past Thunder
articles.description: The offensive display by the Rockets on Sunday afternoon was another indication of how difficult this team will be to defeat when the playoffs begin.

articles.author: Chris ForsbergESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: Shots aren't falling but Marcus Smart still impacts winning for Celtics
articles.description: Even though Marcus Smart may not lead the Celtics in scoring, his propensity for making big plays during key moments has kept him on the floor.

articles.author: Ethan Sherwood StraussESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: Klay Thompson's hot streak allows Warriors to distance themselves from Grizzlies
articles.description: Klay Thompson's shooting allowed Warriors to keep up with Grizzlies until Memphis ran out of gas in the fourth quarter.

articles.author: Baxter HolmesESPN Staff Writer
articles.title: Kobe pulls back curtain on post-NBA storytelling venture
articles.description: His life after basketball in full swing, Kobe Bryant details his latest project: "Canvas City," the second of six features Bryant agreed to direct, write and create for ESPN.

articles.author: Dana O'NeilESPN Senior Writer
articles.title: South Carolina's local approach pays off in trip to the Final Four
articles.description: PJ Dozier and Sindarius Thornwell, both of whom decided to stay in South Carolina, led the Gamecocks past Florida and into the program's first Final Four appearance.

articles.author: Mechelle VoepelespnW.com
articles.title: William's 41 points lead Bulldogs to first Final Four
articles.description: Morgan William hit 6 of 8 3-point attempts and scored a career-high 41 points to drive No. 2 seed Mississippi State to its first Final Four. The Bulldogs beat top-seeded Baylor in overtime 94-85.

articles.author: Graham HaysespnW.com
articles.title: McPhee, Stanford topple 1-seed Notre Dame to reach Final Four
articles.description: In a career-defining performance, junior Brittany McPhee scored 27 points -- including 19 in the second half -- to help Stanford overcome a 16-point deficit and reach its 13th Final Four.
